text:
You are probably aware of this step-by-step example: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/guides/building-dynamic-pages-with-hubdb> So yes, this should be possible as I have done it earlier.

Note that those dynamic pages are not actually landing pages in the analytics. So all sessions are added together to the main page’s analytics. If you want track individual pages, you need check page views in Google Analytics or similar.

Yes, you can use HubDB rows also in modules. Unfortunately your filters sound a bit complex so you might need to play with front-side javascript code. For example to convert people’s address to location code.

And yes, you could use _boolean_ field-type in modules to give content editors a possibility to select visible filters.

Your module isn’t easy to build, but it is possible. Just let me know if you need help with that.
